author.persName: Firishtah, Muḥammad Qāsim Hindū Shāh Astarābādī

msItem.title: Tarikh i Firishtah, or Gulshan-i Ibrahimi.
msItem.note: Folio one, recto: This Book was purchased at Seringa pattem, in July 1799 by David Price. Many marginal notes in English. Between folios 294 and 295 a long inserted slip in shikastah, filling in a lacuna. In Morley's printed catalogue, and Codrington's the MS is said to have come from Sir A. Malet, but in Morley's handwritten catalogue No 76 is said to have come from Major David Price, which is evidently correct. aIntroduction and first two books. Nastalik. Part of the same work as Codrington/Reade No 61. Headings in red.

listBibl.bibl: For Price's bequest see J.R.A.S. 1834 pp., vi, lxxvi-ii. (Reference from Robinson. Last two pages not in the Library copy) and 1836, pp. xii-xiv (an obituary note p. lx).

bindingDesc.p: Red leather Oriental binding with flap and tooled and painted decoration. Flap in poor condition.

acquisition.p: Bequest of Major David Price. See Notes.

availability.p: Visitors are welcome to consult manuscripts in the library by prior appointment. Information on access is available on the library page of the Society's web site at www.royalasiaticsociety.org and appointments can be arranged by e-mailing library@royalasiaticsociety.org
